Title: Exploitation of a Buffer Overflow in Linux

Introduction:
Buffer overflow vulnerabilities are one the most common types of security risks. The exploitation of buffer overflows in Linux is relatively easy since there are many standard libraries that use a null-pointer injection (NUI) method. The aim of this proposal is to write a simple buffer overflow exploit in C which will trigger a heap corruption, leading to a runaway process.

Steps to create exploit:
1. Implement a custom kernel function that triggers the heap corruption.
2. Save an integer variable in the stack, e.g. "a"
3. Set the value of a to some very large number
